basic_info.description: üëã Presently a pandemic-inspired K-2 homeschool teacher and long-time Trekkie, Vida is an avid fan of puppies of all ages and life in VR. Having completed her Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies (English/Mathematics), Associate of Science in pure sciences, and a bartending certification back when she enjoyed leaving the house, she is currently working toward an Advanced Software Development certification in Full-Stack JavaScript. ‚≠ê Thank you for sparing the time to get to know a bit about her!üíú

projects.title: Canine Rescue
projects.description: Though I already had an established history of feeding and caring for strays, my adventures in organized canine rescue started as the result of a lost bet with a friend. Having been out-scored on a quiz I had to volunteer for a shift working with rescued bully breeds. Well, I fell in love with it and went on to spend years working with bullies, Golden Retrievers and several other breeds and mixes falling in love with each furry face along the way. In the intervening years my own pack of furkids grew as well.

projects.title: Teaching
projects.description: The pandemic inspired me to accelerate a previously established plan to relocate back home to the Carolinas from Houston, TX. I started out proctoring/tutoring two nephews and a niece for the 2020-2021 school year and it went so well that I became the full-time teacher for the two boys for the 2021-2022 school year. Unfortunately, due to logistics issues my niece wasn't in attendence this past year but will be returning along with her little sister for 2022-2023.

projects.title: Star Trek
projects.description: I've been a Trekkie ever since I saw my very first episode of The Original Series when I was in primary school. The Trekverse of diversity, inclusion, cooperation, and scientific adventure pretty well sums up my idea of a perfect universe. I am currently working towards a Full-Stack JavaScript Developer Certification with the ultimate goal of making significant contributions to bringing the Roddenberry vision to life in VR!
